title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, April 19, 1866
summary: John Scott writes to AMA administrator Samuel Hunt in order to report C. E. Deweys resignation from her teaching post in Staunton. Scott complains that the schools are overcrowded and that the loss of Dewey might mean that he would need to hire local blacks to help teach.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Women, American Civil War
